Class DungeonMap

java.lang.Object
com.dungeonGame.logic.mapAndLevelHandler.DungeonMap
public class DungeonMap extends Object
Manages the dungeon map and its levels in the Dungeon Game.

The dungeon consists of three levels, each represented as a 2D character array. The class provides methods to retrieve specific levels and initialize the map layout.

    Class

    static class 
    DungeonMap.LevelFactory
    Inner class responsible for creating the layouts of each dungeon level.

  • Field Details

    • levels

      public static char[][][] levels
      Array containing the layouts for all dungeon levels. Each level is a 2D character array.
      • 'W' - Wall
      • ' ' - Walkable room
      • 'E' - Entrance
      • 'X' - Exit

    • currentLevelNumber

      public static int currentLevelNumber
      Tracks the number of the currently active level. Level numbering starts at 1.

    • currentLevel

      public static char[][] currentLevel
      Stores the map of the currently active level.

  • Constructor Details

    • DungeonMap

      public DungeonMap()
      Private constructor to prevent instantiation of the DungeonMap utility class.
      • Purpose: Ensures that the class is used only as a utility and cannot be instantiated.
      • Behavior: Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if instantiation is attempted.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if an attempt is made to instantiate this utility class

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public static void initialize()
      Initializes the dungeon map by creating layouts for all levels. The layouts are generated using the DungeonMap.LevelFactory inner class.

    • getLevel

      public static char[][] getLevel(int levelNumber)
      Retrieves the layout of a specified dungeon level.
      • Valid Input: Levels 1 through 3.
      • Error Handling: Throws IllegalArgumentException for invalid level numbers.
      Parameters:
      levelNumber - the number of the level to retrieve
      Returns:
      the 2D character array representing the level's layout
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the level number is not in the range 1 to 3

    • getCurrentLevel

      public static char[][] getCurrentLevel()
      Retrieves the layout of the current level.
      Returns:
      the 2D character array representing the current level's layout

    • setCurrentLevel

      public static void setCurrentLevel(PositionDataHolder pm, char[][] newLevel, int levelNumber, LevelTransitionHandler levelTransitionHandler)
      Sets the current level to a new layout and level number.

      Internal Method Calls:

      • EncounterManager.assignEncounters(char[][])
      Parameters:
      pm - the player's position manager
      newLevel - the new level's layout
      levelNumber - the number of the new level

    • getCurrentLevelNumber

      public static int getCurrentLevelNumber()
      Retrieves the number of the current level.
      Returns:
      the number of the current level
